Key Match Events: Ildemaro Vargas got a 2-run double that went in and out of the glove of the Pirates' rightfielder with 2-outs for the game winner.
Pre-Game Insights: The Nats are underdogs today, at +135 to win on the moneyline.
The Nats' manager Dave Martinez used Kyle Finnegan for both ends of the doubleheader yesterday for saves.
Expect that a few relievers won’t pitch today.
Post-Match Reflections: Nats' manager Dave Martinez said after yesterday's game, 'They didn’t give up. I talk about these guys every day, about them playing hard to the last out, and they did it again today.'
They don't feel like they're ever out of a game. They feel like if they keep grinding — good things will happen.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Nats starting pitchers have a combined ERA of 4.44 and 22nd in MLB.
The team avoided the dreaded triple-digit loss plateau with the first game win on Saturday and will far exceed the win total that Baseball Prospectus was projecting as they had the Nats going 58-104.
Others: The Nats schedule looks like going forward, and the plan is to get Trevor Williams back into the rotation and finish the final week-and-a-half of the season with a 6-man rotation.
Previews and Updates: The Nationals will go for the series win in the 4-game set with the Pirates today.
The Nats will play at PNC Park, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, with a 1st Pitch at 1:35 pm EDT.
Player Updates: Luis Garcia Jr. at a WAR of +2.9, and Jacob Young at +2.8 on the FanGraphs' WAR leaderboard.
Schedule and Lineup: The Nats schedule looks like going forward, and the plan is to get Trevor Williams back into the rotation and finish the final week-and-a-half of the season with a 6-man rotation.
